docs.title: Welcome to Adaly
docs.text: Welcome to Adaly's user manual! This documentation will guide you through everything you need to know to get the most out of Adaly's powerful research and analytics platform.

docs.title: What is Adaly?
docs.text: Adaly is an advanced research and analytics platform that connects you to a vast array of data sources and AI-powered tools. Whether you're conducting market research, analyzing consumer behavior, or tracking industry trends, Adaly provides the insights you need to make data-driven decisions.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
To help you get started quickly, check out these helpful resources:

  • Sample Queries: Explore example queries to see how you can interact with Adaly and get actionable insights from your data.
  • Request a Connector: Need to connect a new data source? Learn how to request a connector for your favorite platform.
  • Authenticate a Connector for All Brands: Guide to authenticating connectors across multiple brands in your Adaly workspace.

Last updated: October 2025

docs.title: Release Notes
docs.text: Welcome to Adaly's release notes. Below you'll find a comprehensive list of all releases with summaries and links to the full documentation.

docs.title: v2.4.6
docs.text:
Oct 1, 2025

Today’s release includes a powerful new way to collaborate with your team’s data, fresh updates to our YouGov integration, and several platform-wide bug fixes.

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v2.4.5
docs.text:
Sep 24, 2025

This release debuts the Agentics Reporting Agent, automatically generating reports from saved insights without interrupting workflows, alongside platform-wide bug fixes and performance enhancements for a smoother Adaly experience.

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v2.4.4
docs.text:
Sep 17, 2025

This week’s update is short and sweet—but a meaningful one for anyone using YouGov data on the platform.

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v2.4.3
docs.text:
Sep 10, 2025

Welcome to this week’s release! This update focuses on enhancing first-time user experience, improving transparency in data sourcing, and resolving a few lingering bugs. Here’s what’s new!

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v2.4.0
docs.text:
Aug 20, 2025

This release adds CivicScience data, introduces Shelves to save and reuse top responses, and supports CSV uploads, giving you smarter insights, better organization, and more flexible data control in Adaly.

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v2.3.0
docs.text:
Aug 13, 2025

This release streamlines workflows with Excel uploads for instant querying and new bulk chat management tools, making data handling and organization in Adaly faster and more efficient.

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v2.2.0
docs.text:
July 31, 2025

This release adds Grok for real-time social sentiment and ChatGPT integration for direct querying, alongside platform-wide performance boosts and re-enabled text-to-speech for a faster, more dynamic Adaly experience.

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v2.1.0
docs.text:
July 11, 2025

This release enhances flexibility and access with Stripe integration, GA-4 authentication, and expanded LLM support (Cohere, Claude, Gemini). Updated RBAC improves onboarding and credentialed platform access for a smoother, more unified experience.

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v1.3.2
docs.text:
May 22, 2025

This release introduces @adaly, a smarter research agent for faster decisions, and a refreshed sign-up flow with improved design, validation, and transparent terms for a smoother onboarding experience.

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v1.3.1
docs.text:
May 13, 2025

This release introduces major backend upgrades, enhancing speed, reliability, and scalability — laying the foundation for a more powerful, seamless, and future-ready platform experience.

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v1.3.0
docs.text:
Apr 28, 2025

This release launches My Data, allowing users to securely upload and organize documents or URLs by Brand. We’ve also delivered platform-wide bug fixes for a smoother, more reliable experience.

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v1.2.0
docs.text:
Apr 15, 2025

This release introduces Library — automatically saving and organizing chat threads for easy access — and enhances @Research, expanding data depth and delivering richer, more detailed insights across user queries.

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v1.1.0
docs.text:
Apr 9, 2025

This release enhances the chat experience with Chain of Thought reasoning, suggested follow-up queries, improved @Search results, and a new Profile page for managing user information and preferences.

📄 View Full Release Notes

docs.title: v1.0.0
docs.text:
Mar 31, 2025

This release adds @Search, @General, Team Management, new company sign-up with role controls, integration-level data access, and brand voices — customizable filters that shape each user’s chat and data experience.

📄 View Full Release Notes

For questions about any release, please contact our team.

docs.title: Querying a Data Source
docs.text:
1. Click on the chat input bar

2. Type "@" to open the Connector dropdown, from here you can choose any Connector you'd like to query.

3. Select your Connector.

4. Now enter your query, you can refer to the right hand side panel for example queries you can ask this data source.

5. Click on this arrow or press Enter to submit your query.

docs.title: Querying a File Upload
docs.text:
1. Click on the chat input bar

2. Type "/" to open the File Upload dropdown, from here you can choose any of your File Uploads to query

3. Click on the file you'd like to query

4. Enter your query

5. Click the Arrow Icon or press Enter

docs.title: Query multiple Data Sources
docs.text:
1. Click on the chat input bar

2. Type "@" to open the Connector dropdown, from here you can choose any connector to add to your query.

3. Click on the first Connector you'd like to query

4. Click on the chat input bar

5. Type "@" to once again open up the Connector dropdown, here you can add any Connector to your query

6. Click "@Perplexity"

7. Click on the chat input bar

8. Enter your query

9. Click the arrow icon or press enter to submit your query.

docs.title: Sample Queries by Data Source
docs.text: This document provides sample queries for each data source available in the Adaly platform, organized by category and use case.

docs.title: Consumer Sentiment
docs.text:
Track shifts in consumer mood, confidence, and priorities.

Sample Queries:

  • How has public sentiment about the economy changed?

  • What are consumers most concerned about heading into the next quarter?

docs.title: Lifestyle & Behavioral Trends
docs.text:
Explore evolving habits and lifestyle choices.

Sample Queries:

  • Are more people cooking at home versus dining out?

  • How are health and wellness priorities shifting?

docs.title: Purchase Intent & Brand Affinity
docs.text:
Understand what people plan to buy and the brands they love.

Sample Queries:

  • Which brands are gaining loyalty in the fashion industry?

  • What factors are driving purchase decisions for electric vehicles?

docs.title: Demographics & Audience Segmentation
docs.text:
Get granular views of specific audience groups.

Sample Queries:

  • How do Gen Z's media consumption habits differ from Millennials?

  • Which income segments are most optimistic about travel plans?

docs.title: Political, Cultural & Social Insights
docs.text:
Follow evolving opinions on current events and societal issues.

Sample Queries:

  • How are attitudes toward renewable energy changing?

  • What cultural trends are resonating most with younger voters?

docs.title: Longitudinal Trend Analysis
docs.text:
Leverage a decade of historical data to spot patterns over time.

Sample Queries:

  • How has consumer trust in tech companies evolved?

  • Which lifestyle changes from the pandemic era are here to stay?

docs.title: Industry & Market Analysis
docs.text:
Dive into detailed insights across various industries and markets.

Sample Queries:

  • What are the current trends shaping the tech industry?

  • How is the automotive market evolving globally?

docs.title: Consumer Insights & Demographics
docs.text:
Understand consumer behaviours, preferences, and demographics.

Sample Queries:

  • Which demographic segments have the highest purchasing power?

  • How have consumer habits changed in the past year?

docs.title: Economic & Financial Data
docs.text:
Access robust economic indicators and financial metrics.

Sample Queries:

  • What are the latest GDP forecasts for major economies?

  • How are global inflation rates trending?

docs.title: Regional & Country Statistics
docs.text:
Explore precise data tailored to specific regions and countries.

Sample Queries:

  • What's the market outlook for renewable energy in Europe?

  • Which industries drive economic growth in Asia?

docs.title: Marketing & Advertising Trends
docs.text:
Gain insights into marketing effectiveness and advertising trends.

Sample Queries:

  • Which advertising channels offer the best ROI?

  • How are digital marketing budgets changing?

docs.title: Research & Analysis
docs.text:
Claude can help analyze information, synthesize findings, and provide insights on complex topics.

Sample Queries:

  • Analyze market trends and provide strategic recommendations

  • Compare and contrast different business approaches or models

docs.title: Content Creation & Writing
docs.text:
Claude generates high-quality content tailored to your specific needs and audience.

Sample Queries:

  • Draft marketing copy, reports, and strategic documents

  • Create compelling narratives from data and research findings

docs.title: Problem Solving & Strategy
docs.text:
Claude breaks down complex problems and helps develop actionable solutions.

Sample Queries:

  • Identify potential challenges and suggest mitigation strategies

  • Help brainstorm innovative approaches to business challenges

docs.title: Data Interpretation
docs.text:
Claude transforms complex data into clear, actionable insights.

Sample Queries:

  • Explain statistical findings in plain language

  • Identify patterns and trends in research data

docs.title: Critical Thinking & Reasoning
docs.text:
Claude applies logical reasoning to evaluate arguments and assess information quality.

Sample Queries:

  • Evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of different approaches

  • Help you think through complex decisions with multiple factors

docs.title: Brand Mentions & Sentiment
docs.text:
See what people are saying about specific brands and how they feel about them.

Sample Queries:

  • Which brands are generating the most buzz on social media today?

  • What is the overall sentiment (positive, negative, neutral) toward a particular brand?

docs.title: Trending Topics & Hashtags
docs.text:
Uncover the hottest conversations, keywords, and hashtags gaining momentum.

Sample Queries:

  • Which topics are currently trending across different social platforms?

  • What hashtags are people using most frequently in relation to a given event or topic?

docs.title: Audience Language & Behaviour
docs.text:
Dive into the words and phrases people use to talk about products, issues, or experiences.

Sample Queries:

  • How do users describe their experience with a new product launch?

  • What common language patterns emerge when discussing sustainability or health?

docs.title: Cross-Platform Analysis
docs.text:
Compare conversations taking place on different social media sites and forums.

Sample Queries:

  • Which platform hosts the most active discussions about a certain topic?

  • How does user sentiment differ between Twitter and Reddit?

docs.title: Topic & Keyword Insights
docs.text:
Identify key themes, subtopics, and related keywords in online discussions.

Sample Queries:

  • What are the main concerns or pain points expressed around a new policy?

  • Which related keywords often appear alongside a specific product or brand?

docs.title: Cultural & Social Trends
docs.text:
Spot emerging cultural moments and social shifts in real time.

Sample Queries:

  • What new slang or terminology is gaining traction among younger audiences?

  • How are users responding to major cultural events or global news stories?

docs.title: Marketing Performance
docs.text:
Monitor and compare key performance metrics across multiple advertising channels.

Sample Queries:

  • How does your ad spend correlate with the number of impressions?

  • Which campaigns are driving the most clicks over time?

docs.title: Sales & Revenue
docs.text:
Track conversions and revenue to measure the impact of your marketing efforts.

Sample Queries:

  • Observe how sales fluctuate over different time periods

  • Visualize each stage in your customers' journey, from clicks to final purchases

docs.title: Audience Insights
docs.text:
Look at geographical or demographic data to understand where your audiences are most engaged.

Sample Queries:

  • Pinpoint where the majority of your traffic or conversions originate

  • See if your marketing attracts fresh leads or encourages repeat purchases

docs.title: Channel Comparison
docs.text:
Determine which traffic sources (e.g., Facebook, Google, Bing) are most effective for your goals.

Sample Queries:

  • Compare return on ad spend across different channels

  • Identify where your audience interacts most before converting

docs.title: Trend Analysis & Forecasting
docs.text:
Identify growth patterns and forecast future outcomes based on historical data.

Sample Queries:

  • Discover high and low seasons for your sales and engagement

  • Use machine learning or time-series analysis to estimate future performance

docs.title: Market & Industry Trends
docs.text:
Uncover how markets are shifting and which industries are on the rise.

Sample Queries:

  • Which sectors are experiencing the fastest post-pandemic recovery?

  • What are the key factors influencing growth in the global e-commerce market?

Sample Queries:

Stay on top of the technologies reshaping industries and consumer experiences.

Sample Queries:

Sample Queries:

docs.text: Perplexity helps you explore a vast array of publicly available information from across the internet. From marketing and media insights to emerging trends and competitive intelligence, Perplexity brings a world of knowledge to your fingertips.

docs.title: Meta Ads
docs.text: The Meta Marketing Insights API is a component of the broader Meta Marketing API platform that specifically focuses on retrieving detailed performance data and analytics for advertising campaigns run across Meta's family of apps, including Facebook and Instagram.

docs.title: Campaign Performance Analytics
docs.text:
Unlock detailed metrics to evaluate ad effectiveness.

Sample Queries:

  • What is the ROI of my latest Instagram ad campaign?

  • How do my Facebook and Instagram campaigns compare in terms of engagement rates?

docs.title: Audience Segmentation & Insights
docs.text:
Decode audience behavior with demographic and behavioral data.

Sample Queries:

  • Which age groups respond best to video ads?

  • How do conversion rates vary by geographic region?

docs.title: Cross-Platform Performance
docs.text:
Compare and optimize campaigns across Meta's ecosystem.

Sample Queries:

  • How does ad performance differ between desktop and mobile users?

  • What are the top-performing content formats on Facebook vs. Instagram?

docs.title: ROI Optimization & Forecasting
docs.text:
Maximize returns with predictive analytics and budget allocation insights.

Sample Queries:

  • Which campaigns have the highest potential for scaling?

  • How can I reallocate budget to improve ROAS?

docs.title: Google Ads
docs.text: The Google Ads API provides programmatic access to campaign, ad group, and keyword-level data, enabling detailed analysis of performance metrics and optimization opportunities.

docs.title: Campaign Performance Metrics
docs.text:
Track fundamental performance indicators such as impressions, clicks, and conversions at the campaign level.

Sample Queries:

  • What are the impressions for each campaign?

docs.title: Cost & Conversion Analysis
docs.text:
Evaluate efficiency by analyzing cost per conversion and trends over time.

Sample Queries:

  • What is the cost per conversion by campaign, and how does it trend over time?

docs.title: Segmentation by Device, Location & Time
docs.text:
Understand how campaign outcomes vary across devices, geographic regions, and time dimensions.

Sample Queries:

  • How does performance vary by device, location, and time of day?

docs.title: Quality Score & Competitive Positioning
docs.text:
Analyze the relationship between Quality Scores, cost-per-click, and ad positioning.

Sample Queries:

  • How do Quality Scores correlate with CPC and ad position?

docs.title: Time-Based Comparison
docs.text:
Benchmark campaign performance across different time periods to track efficiency and growth.

Sample Queries:

  • How does August CAC performance compare to July?

  • What is the top performing time of day in terms of CAC?

docs.title: Organize & Query by Folder or File
docs.text:
Group files by campaign, client, or topic to streamline your insights.

Sample Queries:

  • What were the top-performing channels across all Q3 marketing assets?

  • Summarize the key takeaways from the "July Campaign Overview.pdf" file

docs.title: Understand File Type Strengths
docs.text:
Group files by campaign, client, or topic to streamline your insights.

Sample Queries:

  • Extract the competitor pricing models from the 'Benchmarking Report.pdf'

  • Summarize client feedback from the 'Customer Survey Analysis.docx'

  • What were the main goals listed in the 'Brand Strategy Presentation.pptx'?

docs.title: Get Cross-Document Insights
docs.text:

Sample Queries:

  • What budget allocations were proposed across all 2024 planning docs?

  • List all KPIs mentioned in the marketing decks from last year

docs.text:
Upload or reference live web content for AI-powered summarization and analysis.

Sample Queries:

  • Summarize the key takeaways from this McKinsey article on digital marketing trends

  • What are the growth projections according to the Forrester report I linked?

docs.title: Text Generation & Writing
docs.text:
Create high-quality content tailored to your specific requirements and style.

Sample Queries:

  • Generate marketing copy and promotional materials

  • Draft professional reports and business documents

docs.title: Language Understanding & Analysis
docs.text:
Analyze and extract meaning from text with advanced natural language processing.

Sample Queries:

  • Perform sentiment analysis on customer feedback

  • Extract key themes and insights from documents

docs.title: Content Summarization
docs.text:
Distill complex information into clear, concise summaries.

Sample Queries:

  • Summarize research papers and industry reports

  • Create executive summaries from detailed analyses

docs.title: Classification & Categorization
docs.text:
Organize and classify text-based content efficiently.

Sample Queries:

  • Categorize customer inquiries and support tickets

  • Tag and organize content for better searchability

docs.title: Search & Information Retrieval
docs.text:
Find relevant information quickly from large text collections.

Sample Queries:

  • Search through knowledge bases for specific information

  • Identify relevant passages from extensive documentation

docs.title: Authenticating a Connector for all brands
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "Brand Voice"

4. Click on your intended brand

5. Click "My Connectors"

6. Click this icon.

7. Click "Configure"

8. Click "Click to Authenticate"

Tip: This activates the connector for all brands by default. You can use the toggles on the left hand side to activate/deactivate this connector for specific brands.

9. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Configure ChatGPT Connector
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "My Connectors"

4. Click the Gear icon

5. Click "Configure"

6. Click the "Type or Paste Key Here" field and enter your API Key.

7. Click "Authenticate"

8. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Configure Civic Science Connector
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "My Connectors"

4. Click the Gear icon

5. Click Configure

6. Click the "Username" field and enter your username

7. Click the "Password" field and enter your password

8. Click "Authenticate"

9. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Configure Claude Connector
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "My Connectors"

4. Click the Gear icon

5. Click Configure

6. Click the "Type or Paste Key Here" field.

7. Enter your API Key and click Authenticate

8. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Configure Cohere Connector
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "My Connectors"

4. Click the Gear icon

5. Click "Configure"

6. Click the "Type or Paste Key Here" field and enter your API key

7. Click "Authenticate"

8. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Configure GA4 Connector
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "My Connectors"

4. Click the Gear icon

5. Click "Configure"

6. Click the "Property ID" field and enter your Property ID

7. Click Upload JSON File and upload, then click Authenticate

8. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Configure Gemini Connector
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "My Connectors"

4. Click the Gear icon

5. Click Configure

6. Click the "Type or Paste Key Here" field and enter your API key

7. Click "Authenticate"

8. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Configure Grok Connector
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "My Connectors"

4. Click the Gear icon

5. Click "Configure"

6. Click the "Grok API key" field.

7. Enter your Grok API Key, then click on the X API key field

8. Enter your X API key

9. Click "Authenticate"

10. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Configure GWI Connector
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click this icon.

3. Click "My Connectors"

4. Click the Gear icon

5. Click "Configure"

6. Click the "Type or Paste Key Here" field and enter your API key.

7. Click "Authenticate"

8. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Configure Perplexity Connector
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "My Connectors"

4. Click the Gear icon

5. Click "Configure"

6. Click the "Type or Paste Key Here" field and enter your API key

7. Click "Authenticate"

8. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Configure Snowflake Connector
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "My Connectors"

4. Click the Gear icon

5. Click "Configure"

6. Click the "User Name" field and enter your username

7. Click the "Account Identifier" field and enter your account identifier

8. Click the "Database" field and enter your database

9. Click the "Schema" field.

10. Click the "Programmatic Access Token" field and enter your Programmatic Access Token

11. Click "Authenticate"

12. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Configure Statista Connector
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "My Connectors"

4. Click the Gear icon

5. Click "Configure"

6. Click the "Type or Paste Key Here" field and enter your API key

7. Click "Authenticate"

8. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Configure Snowflake Connector
docs.text:
1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "My Connectors"

4. Click the Gear icon

5. Click "Configure"

6. Click the "User Name" field and enter your username

7. Click the "Account Identifier" field and enter your account identifier

8. Click the "Database" field and enter your database

9. Click the "Schema" field.

10. Click the "Programmatic Access Token" field and enter your Programmatic Access Token

11. Click "Authenticate"

12. Click "Finish"

docs.title: Confirm a Connector Request
docs.text:
After a Member makes a request, an Admin needs to approve their Connector Request in order for them to be able to use it. This guide provides step by step instructions for any Admin with paid access.

1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

3. Click "Connector Requests"

4. Click the checkmark next to the connector request you intend to confirm

5. Click "Save"

6. Click "Confirm Payment"

docs.title: Request a Connector
docs.text:
Requesting a Connector is how Company Members can gain access to new Data Sources. Below is a step by step guide on how to do so, feel free to apply this to the Connector of your choice!

1. Hover over the Plus icon to open the Navigation Menu

2. Click on the Integrations logo.

Tip: Locate your intended connector through the Discover section

3. Click "Request Connector"

docs.title: Change Your Name
docs.text:
1. Hover over your Profile Picture in the top right

2. Click "Account Settings"

3. Click "Change" under your Name

4. Enter your new name, and press Enter to confirm the change

docs.title: Change Your Password
docs.text:
1. Hover over your Profile Picture in the top right

2. Click "Account Settings"

3. Click "Change Password"

4. Click the "Enter your old password" field and enter your current password.

5. Click the "Enter your new password" field and enter your new password.

6. Click the "Re-enter your new password" field and re-enter your new password.

7. Click "Save"
